block.p: Rachel Laura Stern, a stage manager at the New York City Opera, and Derek James Davis, the company's manager, are to be married today. The Rev. Edward Kacerguis, a Roman Catholic priest, will officiate with Rabbi Joel S. Goor at Studio 450 in New York.

The bride, 30, is also a stage manager for the JVC Jazz Festival and the Lincoln Center Out-of-Doors festival, also in New York. She graduated cum laude from Brandeis University. Her parents, Virginia and Robert Stern, live in Washington, where her father is a consultant in technology management. Her mother directs a project of the American Association for the Advancement of Science that introduces people with disabilities to careers in science and engineering.

Rachel Laura Stern, a stage manager at the New York City Opera, and Derek James Davis, the company's manager, are to be married today. The Rev. Edward Kacerguis, a Roman Catholic priest, will officiate with Rabbi Joel S. Goor at Studio 450 in New York.

The bride, 30, is also a stage manager for the JVC Jazz Festival and the Lincoln Center Out-of-Doors festival, also in New York. She graduated cum laude from Brandeis University. Her parents, Virginia and Robert Stern, live in Washington, where her father is a consultant in technology management. Her mother directs a project of the American Association for the Advancement of Science that introduces people with disabilities to careers in science and engineering.

The bridegroom, 32, graduated from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, from which he also received an M.B.A. degree. He is a son of Mary-Ellen and Dean Davis of Hyde Park, N.Y. His father is a toll collector at the Mid-Hudson Bridge in Poughkeepsie, N.Y.
